sn4.15:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn4.15:1.3: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and addressed him in verse:
sn4.15:3.3: desire for these is gone from me.
sn4.15:4.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
